metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

title.gco:CharacterString: Offshore Tidal Hydrokinetic Projects for United States Waters, June 2013

organisationName.gco:CharacterString: United States. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration

collectiveTitle.gco:CharacterString: Northeast Ocean Data: GIS data for planning in the northeastern United States

abstract.gco:CharacterString: Pending or issued preliminary permits* or issued licenses for offshore hydrokinetic projects that produce energy from the flow of water in ocean currents or tides. The status of these projects is administered by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC). This dataset excludes any sites considered inland. Listings found for maximum capacity and average annual production are estimates obtained from applications submitted to FERC by the licensee. Actual numbers upon build-out could vary. *Preliminary permits maintain priority of application for a license for up to three years while a potential license applicant explores project feasibility and prepares a license application, but do not authorize construction, operation, or maintenance of a hydropower project. While studies are often carried out while potential applicants hold preliminary permits, the permits do not authorize any activity or site access. Such permissions must be obtained from the appropriate authority. In some cases, potential license applicants can obtain a successive permit if they have pursued the preparation of a license application in good faith and with due diligence. Only a small portion of preliminary permits lead to licenses.

purpose.gco:CharacterString: To support coastal and ocean planning and other activities pursuant to the Energy Policy Act, Coastal Zone Management Act, Magnuson-Stevens Fishery Conservation and Management Act, National Environmental Policy Act, Rivers and Harbors Act and the Submerged Lands Act.

credit.gco:CharacterString: U.S. Department of Commerce, U.S. National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Ocean Service, Coastal Services Center. (2013). Offshore Tidal Hydrokinetic Projects for United States Waters, June 2013. NOAA Coastal Services Center. Available at: http://purl.stanford.edu/qv264ny4349.

useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: These data are intended for coastal and ocean use planning. Not for navigation.

NOAA makes no warranties or representations whatsoever regarding the availability, quality, accuracy, content, completeness or suitability for the user’s needs of such information. The services, information, and data made available on the Multipurpose Marine Cadastre web site are provided ‘as is’ without warranties of any kind. These data are intended for coastal and ocean use planning. Not for navigation.

title.gco:CharacterString: Northeast Ocean Data: GIS data for planning in the northeastern United States

environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.3.1.4959

title.gco:CharacterString: Feature catalog for Offshore Tidal Hydrokinetic Projects for United States Waters, June 2013

evaluationMethodDescription.gco:CharacterString: These data are believed to be logically consistent. Geometry is topologically clean.

measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: These data are believed to be logically consistent. Geometry is topologically clean.

Spatial and attribute properties are believed to be complete, although attribute information has been simplified. Geometric thresholds from original data are preserved. No tests have been completed for exhaustiveness.
The attributes in this dataset are believed to be accurate.
Maximum scale of intended use is 1:80,000.

description.gco:CharacterString: 1 Request packaged spatial data of Hydrokinetic Sites from Stephen Bowler of Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (FERC) - denied access to packaged spatial data; 2 Acquire original source data and maintain a copy in individual hydrokinetic project folders on the working directory ); 3 Download spreadsheets from FERC listing issued and pending Hydrokinetic Projects http://www.ferc.gov/industries/hydropower/gen-info/licensing/hydrokinetics.asp and http://www.ferc.gov/industries/hydropower/gen-info/licensing/hydrokinetics/licences.asp; 4 Build Excel spreadsheet with downloaded FERC data and store in working directory; 5 Sort through FERC data and aggregate projects with Hydrokinetic - Tidal or Hydrokinetic – Wave; 6 Copy and paste Hydrokinetic - Tidal Permit or Hydrokinetic - Wave Permit to HydrokineticGIS.xls; 7 Copy and paste Pending Hydrokinetic Preliminary Permits to HydrokineticGIS.xls; 8 Copy and paste Issued and Pending Hydrokinetic Projects Licenses to HydrokineticGIS.xls; 9 Determine what data to gather about Hydrokinetic Sites; 10 Search for all recorded applicant documents by the Hydrokinetic Project Applicant related to applications, letters, and reports provided to FERC http://www.ferc.gov/docs-filing/elibrary.asp; 11 Sort and save relevant applicant documents in hydrokinetic project folders on the working directory; 12 Convert X,Y in decimal-minute-seconds to decimal degrees using formula supplied by MMC Data Steward; 13 Convert easting and northing UTM coordinates to X,Y in decimal degrees http://home.hiwaay.net/~taylorc/toolbox/geography/geoutm.html; source for UTM zone maps http://www.geog.ucsb.edu/~jeff/g151_coc/lecture3_g151f08.pdf; 14 Convert easting, northing in California State Plane III feet NAD83 (zone 0403) to meters using conversion 1 foot = 0.3048 meters and then to X,Y in decimal degrees website http://www.ngs.noaa.gov/TOOLS/spc.shtml San Francisco Bay Tidal Energy Project; 15 Convert X,Y in decimal-minute format to X,Y in degrees-minutes-seconds by converting decimals to seconds (multiply decimal by 60) then convert to X,Y in decimal degrees; 16 document x,y from most up-to-date source including Application, Revised Application, Report and Letters provided to FERC. 17. confirmed x,y corrdinates for several project locations with licensees 18 Shorten X,Y to 5 decimal places in excel spreadsheet with formula FIXED(cell,decimal), copy/paste value, and convert to number; update coordinates; overwrite old feature class with new feature class; 19 Create a development file geodatabase (FGDB); 20 Add Excel spreadsheet data into ArcGIS in file geodatabase as Feature Class entitled HydrokineticSites -- Create Feature Class > From X Y Table; 21 Upload BOEM Outer Continental Shelf Lease Blocks as a layer http://csc.noaa.gov/mmcviewer/; 22 Upload Ocean Basemap -- File > arcgisonline > Ocean Basemap; 23 Confirm all data points are in correct location and distance from nearest mainland location referenced in Application Documents using the Ocean Basemap -- Attribute Table > Select by Attribute; 24 Define field aliases in Feature Class HydrokineticSites Field aliases are defined; 25 Define field domains in Feature Class HydrokineticSites Field domains; 26. Provide all documentation and data to Technical Lead for QA\QC. 27. Based on QA/QC checks and future use of datasets it was determined to distinguished tidal versus wave energy hydrokinetic sites. These were therefore seperated into their own feature classes. 28. the field energyType was then deleted. 29. Metadata, descriptions, and symbology were updated based on this new criteria.

alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: FERC General Information for Hydropower Lincensing 2012

description.gco:CharacterString: 27. Modify HydrokineticSites.xls with necessary changes to X,Y coordinates, delete original Feature Class entitled HydrokineticSites from file geodatabase and create a new Feature Class entitled HydrokineticSites in file geodatabase reflecting these changes; 28. exported table as a dbf as new coordinates edited in step 37 were not representative of the original spatial data created by student intern.; 29. researched FERC site, downloaded excel spreadsheets for licensed, submitted pending applications, and approved preliminary permits; 30. decided not to include any sites which were denied, rejected, cancelled, or surrendered; 31. deleted unnecessary fields and new fields and updated DataDictionary in the SOP; 32. verified and created new attributes based on excel spreadsheets obtained from FERC mentioned in step 29; 33. any entries not found within FERC's spreadsheet were researched through their eLibrary by project number verified attributes based on information found through these searches.; 34. imported x,y data as event class in arcmap, exported this point file as a feature class.; 35. created polygon feature class and created polygons based on point vertices as boundary coordinates; 36. For symbology purposes decided to create a single point feature for each dataset by running the feature to point tool (creates a point in the center of the polygon source layer); 37. Create layer file for symbology; 38. Annually evaluate source data to determine requirement for replacement.

positionName.gco:CharacterString: Multipurpose Marine Cadastre Data Steward/Technical Lead

alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: FERC General Information for Hydropower Lincensing 2012

description.gco:CharacterString: Download new xls documents regarding updates to preliminary permits and approved licenses from the FERC Hydro site (see source listing for URLs) cross-referenced this information with existing feature class. For any existing projects that were missing from the spreadsheet searched FERC eLibrary for documentation relating to status of project then deleted any existing with any that had been cancelled, surrendered or terminated since last update to feature class. Added any new projects by looking up their coordinated within their application materials found within the FERC eLibrary searching by the project number. Created a spreadsheet with new coordinate information converted to decimal degrees, kept new polygon and point features separate, added x,y data into ArcMap based on these two tables. When new features were polygons: created features within a polygon feature class, converted polygons to points based on their center using centroid tool, copied and pasted these into existing feature class, and added attributes needed for completion. When new features were just point locations copied and pasted these into existing feature class and added attributes needed. Updated metadata and created new data download files.

alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: FERC General Information for Hydropower Lincensing June 2013
